misdeed: Travelers in a desolate, marshy region report being lured off the path by flickering lights, only to find themselves hopelessly lost and disoriented.
solution: The Vaesen is a Will-o'-the-Wisp and can be put to rest by returning the land it guards to its rightful owner.

clues.description: Witnesses describe seeing dancing lights of various colors, often blue, green, or white, hovering over the marshes at night.
Local legends tell of restless spirits trapped between worlds, their souls unable to find peace, who lure travelers to their deaths.
Compasses and other navigational tools malfunction erratically in the vicinity of the lights, spinning wildly or pointing in the wrong direction.
The ground near where the lights appear is often soft and treacherous, swallowing those who stray too close.
Those who claim to have seen the lights up close speak of feeling an unnatural chill and hearing whispers carried on the wind.
Research into local history reveals a long-standing land dispute, with accusations of deceit and foul play leading to the disappearance of one of the involved parties.

plotTwist.description: A group of children, playing a prank on a superstitious traveler, accidentally summon the Vaesen while mimicking the folklore they've heard about the marsh.
